scenarioDescription:
The HD 81688 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 81688 is a star with 2.1 times the mass of the Sun, and 13 times its radius. It is located 279.58 light years away from the solar system.

HD 81688 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 81688 system


HD 81688 b

HD 81688 b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2008-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.81 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 81688 b is 858.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 81688 b is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 81688 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 81688, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: HD 81688 - System With 1 Exoplanet
